name: bbn\Db\Internal\Actions

getRow.name: getRow
getRow.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an array indexed with the fields' name.
getRow.comments:
/**
   * Return the first row resulting from the query as an array indexed with the fields' name.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getRow("SELECT id, name FROM table_users WHERE id > ? ", 2));;
   *
   * /* (array)[
   *        "id" => 3,
   *        "name" => "thomas",
   *        ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query.
   * @param int The var ? value.
   * @return array|false
   *
   */

getRows.name: getRows
getRows.summary: Return an array that includes indexed arrays for every row resultant from the query.

doc.description: Return an array that includes indexed arrays for every row resultant from the query.

getRows.comments:
/**
   * Return an array that includes indexed arrays for every row resultant from the query.
   *
   * @param string
   * @param int The var ? value
   * @return array|false
   */

getIrow.name: getIrow
getIrow.summary: Return a row as a numeric indexed array.
getIrow.comments:
/**
   * Return a row as a numeric indexed array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getIrow("SELECT id, name, surname FROM table_users WHERE id > ?", 2));
   * /* (array) [
   *              3,
   *              "john",
   *              "brown",
   *             ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query
   * @param int The var ? value
   * @return array | false
   */

getIrows.name: getIrows
getIrows.summary: Return an array of numeric indexed rows.
getIrows.comments:
/**
   * Return an array of numeric indexed rows.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getIrows("SELECT id, name FROM table_users WHERE id > ? LIMIT ?", 2, 2));
   * /*
   * (array)[
   *         [
   *          3,
   *         "john"
   *         ],
   *         [
   *         4,
   *         "barbara"
   *        ]
   *       ]
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|array
   */

getByColumns.name: getByColumns
getByColumns.summary: Return an array indexed on the searched field's in which there are all the values of the column.
getByColumns.comments:
/**
   * Return an array indexed on the searched field's in which there are all the values of the column.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getByColumns("SELECT name, surname FROM table_users WHERE id > 2"));
   * /*
   * (array) [
   *      "name" => [
   *       "John",
   *       "Michael"
   *      ],
   *      "surname" => [
   *        "Brown",
   *        "Smith"
   *      ]
   *     ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query
   * @return null|array
   */

getObj.name: getObj
getObj.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an object (similar to {@link getObject()}).

getObject.name: getObject
getObject.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an object.
getObject.comments:
/**
   * Return the first row resulting from the query as an object.
   * Synonym of get_obj.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getObject("SELECT name FROM table_users"));
   * /*
   * (obj){
   *       "name" => "John"
   *       }
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|\stdClass
   */

getObjects.name: getObjects
getObjects.summary: Return an array of stdClass objects.
getObjects.comments:
/**
   * Return an array of stdClass objects.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getObjects("SELECT name FROM table_users"));
   *
   * /*
   * (array) [
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "John",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Michael",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Thomas",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "William",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Jake",
   *          },
   *         ]
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|array
   */

dummyComments:
/**
   * Return the first row resulting from the query as an array indexed with the fields' name.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getRow("SELECT id, name FROM table_users WHERE id > ? ", 2));;
   *
   * /* (array)[
   *        "id" => 3,
   *        "name" => "thomas",
   *        ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query.
   * @param int The var ? value.
   * @return array|false
   *
   */

/**
   * Return an array that includes indexed arrays for every row resultant from the query.
   *
   * @param string
   * @param int The var ? value
   * @return array|false
   */

/**
   * Return a row as a numeric indexed array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getIrow("SELECT id, name, surname FROM table_users WHERE id > ?", 2));
   * /* (array) [
   *              3,
   *              "john",
   *              "brown",
   *             ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query
   * @param int The var ? value
   * @return array | false
   */

/**
   * Return an array of numeric indexed rows.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getIrows("SELECT id, name FROM table_users WHERE id > ? LIMIT ?", 2, 2));
   * /*
   * (array)[
   *         [
   *          3,
   *         "john"
   *         ],
   *         [
   *         4,
   *         "barbara"
   *        ]
   *       ]
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Return an array indexed on the searched field's in which there are all the values of the column.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getByColumns("SELECT name, surname FROM table_users WHERE id > 2"));
   * /*
   * (array) [
   *      "name" => [
   *       "John",
   *       "Michael"
   *      ],
   *      "surname" => [
   *        "Brown",
   *        "Smith"
   *      ]
   *     ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string query
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Return the first row resulting from the query as an object.
   * Synonym of get_obj.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getObject("SELECT name FROM table_users"));
   * /*
   * (obj){
   *       "name" => "John"
   *       }
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|\stdClass
   */

/**
   * Return an array of stdClass objects.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getObjects("SELECT name FROM table_users"));
   *
   * /*
   * (array) [
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "John",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Michael",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Thomas",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "William",
   *          },
   *          Object stdClass: df {
   *            "name" => "Jake",
   *          },
   *         ]
   * ```
   *
   * @return null|array
   */

/**

   * @return array|null
   * @throws Exception

/**

   * @throws Exception
